TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: When you draw rockets on your final exam.
Guess what I found i my conspects...
When I made this picture.

when i made this picture.

http://i.imgur.com/p3wizos.jpg

Quote!!!!:D:D
When you spend the entirety of 'Gravity' naming ISS modules and pointing out physics errors.

When I made this picture.

http://i.imgur.com/p3WIZOS.jpg

This is true.

When you spend the entirety of 'Gravity' naming ISS modules and pointing out physics errors.

I did that exact thing.

When I made this picture.

http://i.imgur.com/p3WIZOS.jpg

It's... It's beautiful!

When you spend the entirety of 'Gravity' naming ISS modules and pointing out physics errors.

I did this too. *shamefulface*

When my latest english project turns into a 6 page beginnings-of-a-novel-chapter story about a lathe colonization mission (which I then began building modules for, planning to actually execute when my shipyard is done)

When, in a delusion state of kinda-sorta-not-really-asleep, an image of a craft flashes in your mind, you judge it to be an SSTO since it's only engines are RAPIERS, after getting some sleep and getting on KSP, you build it, launch it, and lo-and-behold, it actually is an SSTO.

Either that, or when everything that the announcer says during a rocket launch makes perfect sense, since you know so much about orbital mechanics and rocket science.

I like to plan my upcoming flights when I'm bored in school.

...I can relate to that...

When you are contunually lurking on the forums when I have a dumb laws of life essay due tomorrow, which I'd rather ignore and keep lurking.

Also, when you can build a 1000+ part interplanetary colony ship for Lathe in your head and it works.

When you can have a perfectly intelligent conversation about orbital mechanics with a friend, only to realize he has no clue what you are talking about (and then proceed to give him a crash course in orbital mechanics).

EDIT:

When you leave your room mumbling about failure and your sister says "Moar boosters?"
When you look at a random car and seriously think about how to get it to Duna.

When you look at a random car and seriously think about how to get it to Duna.

With about 1200 dv of course!

If you laugh(like I did) when seeing this:

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=723099847709242&set=a.240767269275838.66315.240760572609841&type=1

NOTE: I'm not the creator of the image, Cropine (from reddit) have all the credit for the image(which I found when the Facebook page of KSP).

PS:if you don't understand the joke, "99 problem" is a song(you can find the lyrics here: http://www.sing365.com/music/lyric.nsf/99-Problems-lyrics-Jay-Z/91AC14F077BCF79848256DDF0006C3F1)
When you spend all day writing up an episode ABOUT playing KSP, so you never actually get a chance to PLAY KSP.
When you plan your night around playing KSP and watching sci-fi films.

When you spend all day writing up an episode ABOUT playing KSP, so you never actually get a chance to PLAY KSP.

I have done that more times then I care to forget
When you start teaching your friends and family orbital mechanics. Most of my friends are programmers or mathematicians though, so they don't find it that strange
when you feel a need of watching Scott's new youtube clips on orbital mechanics in order to play the game.

When you tell your date:

"You have a great pair of attachment nodes"

#fail

When you spend all day writing up an episode ABOUT playing KSP, so you never actually get a chance to PLAY KSP.

Heh - I can relate to that one!

When you tell your date:

"You have a great pair of attachment nodes"

#fail

Lol. Or "You'd look better if you decoupled some boosters".
You know you play to much when you do it during an exam....
When you look up in the sky and see a faint light and think "I can see Minmus!"

When youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re on the same flight and you start talking about the aircraftÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s design and SSTOÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s with a really cute girl next to you that has no clue what you are talking about.
